lx4p

Class LXPColorPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • lx4p.LXPColorPicker

  • public class LXPColorPicker
extends java.lang.Object
    LXColorPicker Displays a color wheel type color picker. If mousePressed when render() is called, the color at the mouse location is saved into current
    Author:
    Claude Heintz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int current
      x and y are the coordinates of the top left point w and h are the width and height current holds the last color selected

      x and y are the coordinates of the top left point w and h are the width and height current holds the last color selected

      x and y are the coordinates of the top left point w and h are the width and height current holds the last color selected

      • degreesToPoint

        public double degreesToPoint(double dy,
                    double dx)
        degreesToPoint is a utility function for calculating the angle from the origin to a point
        Parameters:
        dy - y coordinate of the point
        dx - x coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        angle in degrees counter clockwise from the positive x axis

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet p)
        draw simply renders the image
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet in which to draw the picker

      • pick

        public boolean pick(processing.core.PApplet p)
        Updates the color selected if the mouse is down inside the picker. This is called in the Processing Applet's draw() method so that the mouse can be continually tracked
        Parameters:
        p - the Processing Applet
        Returns:
        true if the selected color was updated
